questions.text: Who is the first mutant animal seen?
questions.explanation:
A mutant alligator.

	Award-winning reporter Alex Roberts is in the African country of Niganda, covering a bloody and terrible conflict. The animal strikes so fast that it is only when some technicians slow the tape down that they see the attacker clearly. These events happened in " Uncanny X-Men" #175, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: Whom do the X-Men discover in The Factory?
questions.explanation:
Black Panther.

	In The Factory, where the mutant animals were created, Wolverine catches a scent of something alive, which leads the team to the Black Panther, king of Wakanda, a nation that neighbors Niganda. The team found the hero in "Uncanny X-Men" #175, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: How did Black Panther remove M'Butu from power?
questions.correct: He punched his teeth out one at a time
options: He broke both of his legs
questions.explanation:
He punched his teeth out one at a time.

	Due to Wakanda's non-intervention policies, Black Panther couldn't take any action until M'Butu tried to annex Wakanda. After listening to threats against his family and country, T'Challa punched the teeth out of M'Butu's mouth one by one. This incident is recalled in "Black Panther" #8, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: What kind of ape hypnotizes the Black Panther?
questions.explanation:
A Baboon.

	"I hate baboons!" proclaims the King of Wakanda shortly before being hypnotized by a talking mutant baboon. This lines him up to be whacked by a strong mutant gorilla. T'Challa falls victim to the vicious apes in "Black Panther" #8, which debuted in 2005.

questions.text: Who spots T'Challa with his bodyguards?
questions.explanation:
Storm.

	Two of Black Panther's royal bodyguards, called Dora Milajae, helped him defeat the apes, although he claimed that he was simply pretending to be hypnotized in order to lull the primates into letting their guard down. When Storm sees T'Challa with his scantily-clad bodyguards, she walks away in a huff. Storm got jealous in "Uncanny X-Men" #176, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: Polaris is being intravenously fed snake venom.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Erich Paine had captured the X-Men and had intended to make them his slaves by operating on their brain; he even hooked Polaris up to an IV full of snake venom to ensure their cooperation, but all didn't turn out well. Polaris suffered in "Uncanny X-Men" #176, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: How did Wolverine track the Red Ghost?
questions.correct: By smelling the vodka on his breath
questions.explanation:
By smelling the vodka on his breath.

	Wolverine tracks the Red Ghost, who uses his intangibility power to phase through a wall. Iceman freezes everything so the team can track him by the footpirnts in the frost or his breath in the air, but this cancels out all scents. These events happened in "Black Panther" #9, which went on sale in 2005.

questions.text: Who shows up to battle T'Challa?
questions.explanation:
Dragon Man.

	Dragon Man is a slow-witted android that was originally brought to life by the villainous alchemist Diablo. He has fought the Fantastic Four, the Hulk, Captain America, Spider-Man, and many other heroes. Black Panther whacks him on his nose, making his attack stop. Dragon Man first appeared in "Fantastic Four" #35, which went on sale in 2005.

Red Ghost.

	After battling a handful of the X-Men to a standstill, Paine briefly contemplates his career choices before having his heart ripped out by the Red Ghost. Unfazed, the Ghost turns intangible and goes to look for his ape henchmen. These events happened in "Black Panther" #9, which went on sale in 2005.

Black Panther and Storm.

	The pair have quite a history. and would go on to get married shortly before the Superhuman Civil War. After Iceman freezes a killer virus and Red Ghost's ape sidekicks, the X-Men depart, leaving Storm behind so she can help the people who worship her. Storm makes the choice in "Black Panther" #9, which went on sale in 2005.
